pr_data.title: [docs] Demo how to use a specific slide direction for Snackbar
pr_data.body:
- [X] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

Fix #21053

In [this comment](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/issues/21053#issuecomment-861394577), Olivier suggested putting the plain example under the ["Change Transition"](https://next.material-ui.com/components/snackbars/#change-transition) heading. However, I placed it under the ["Control Slide direction"](https://next.material-ui.com/components/snackbars/#control-slide-direction) heading because I thought it suited better here. Please confirm.

labels.description: Improvements or additions to the documentation

pr_data.title: [docs] Added a demo in Enable color on dark section.
pr_data.body:
close #28962

### **Summary**

- Added a demo in the "Enable Color on Dark" section. 

- The section in the documentation about this: https://mui.com/components/app-bar/#enable-color-on-dark.

_Previously it had only the steps to enable color on dark mode.  By adding a demo, it will give more clarity to developers on this matter._

### **Changes**

- Added a demo - Demo contains a Switch to toggle between enabling and disabling of color on dark mode. 

- Also added a separate theme mode change button on the app bar to check the difference between light and dark modes.

### **Preview**
![Capture1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62241653/137699336-7f59e503-853b-4e9f-99f4-5b2972f57e56.PNG)
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62241653/137699517-d726e576-bda3-45d6-95ad-35e1494b7d2e.PNG)

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

labels.name: docs
labels.description: Improvements or additions to the documentation.

pr_data.title: [TextField] Fix missing space before asterisk in `OutlinedInput`'s label
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thanks so much for your PR, your contribution is appreciated! ‚ù§Ô∏è -->


- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

Fixes #29206


**Problem:**

- When the required is being set in the Formcontrol component , the border of input touches the end of the label, and it does not add a non-breaking space between border and asterik. Meanwhile, this non-breaking space is being considered when the input is created by Textfield component.

**Solution:**

- Adding `'\u00a0*'` to the OutlinedInput's label when¬†required¬†is set.
commit_messages: Add non-breaking space and asterisk to OutlinedInput component
Add test for OutlinedInput component to check the label prop value

labels.name: component: text field
labels.description: This is the name of the generic UI component, not the React module!

pr_data.body_cleaned:
- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

Fixes #29206


**Problem:**

- When the required is being set in the Formcontrol component , the border of input touches the end of the label, and it does not add a non-breaking space between border and asterik. Meanwhile, this non-breaking space is being considered when the input is created by Textfield component.

**Solution:**

- Adding `'\u00a0*'` to the OutlinedInput's label when¬†required¬†is set.

pr_data.title: [Masonry] Export in packages/mui-lab/src/index.(js|d.ts)
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thanks so much for your PR, your contribution is appreciated! ‚ù§Ô∏è -->

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

Fixes #29705 with the solution proposed by @siriwatknp

#### Source of error:
When attempting to use Masonry like so:
`import {Masonry} from '@mui/lab';`

the component cannot be found.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66718489/142486654-7b054d3a-efc7-4e18-8492-a0814f620e1d.png)

#### Fix:
By export Masonry in packages/mui-lab/src/index.(js|d.ts)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66718489/142486945-fbe5ad8a-d756-4ff7-9e73-57b05157b0e4.png)

pr_data.title: [system] Fix duplicated styles in Box
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thanks so much for your PR, your contribution is appreciated! ‚ù§Ô∏è -->
fixes #33443 

The `Box` should not forward the `sx` prop to the override component. We can overwrite the `shouldForwardProp`  function of the `@mui/styled-engine` to solve the problem.

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

pr_data.title: [joy-ui][GlobalStyles] Ensure compatibility with RSC
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! ‚ù§Ô∏è -->

Closes #38494 

### What I Did

In this pull request, I made the following changes:

1. Created a new file, `GlobalStyles.tsx`, in the `packages/mui-joy/src/GlobalStyles` folder.
2. Modified the `packages/mui-joy/src/GlobalStyles/index.tsx` file to export the `GlobalStyles`.
3. Ran the script `yarn rsc:build` to insert the `use client` directive into the `GlobalStyles.tsx` file.

I followed the guidance provided by @siriwatknp in the following comment: https://github.com/mui/material-ui/issues/38494#issuecomment-1714903097.

---

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

3. Ran the script `yarn rsc:build` to insert the `use client` directive into the `GlobalStyles.tsx` file.

I followed the guidance provided by @siriwatknp in the following comment: https://github.com/mui/material-ui/issues/38494#issuecomment-1714903097.

pr_data.title: [joy-ui][FormControl] Fix issue with the conditional setting of `htmlFor` and `id` attributes not functioning properly for form labels
pr_data.body:
<!-- Thanks so much for your PR, your contribution is appreciated! ‚ù§Ô∏è -->

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

As mentioned by [PhillipWinder](https://github.com/PhillipWinder) in the bug report, if either the `'id'` or `'htmlFor'` is undefined, they are currently removed from the DOM instead of being set to their default values. This issue arises due to `externalForwardedProps` overriding `additionalProps`. To address this, we can fix the problem by conditionally adding `htmlFor` / `id` to `externalForwardedProps`. Additionally, I have included tests to verify that the behaviour with undefined values is now correct. 

Fixes #40112.
commit_messages: [joy-ui][FormLabel] Add undefined checks for htmlFor and id attributes
[joy-ui][FormLabel] Fix tests should have FormControl wrapper
[joy-ui][FormLabel] Move tests to the FormControl & htmlFor/id to additionalProps
[joy-ui][FormControl] Use testing library getByText instead of container
move tests outside of the Input test block
pr_data.body_cleaned:
- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

As mentioned by [PhillipWinder](https://github.com/PhillipWinder) in the bug report, if either the `'id'` or `'htmlFor'` is undefined, they are currently removed from the DOM instead of being set to their default values. This issue arises due to `externalForwardedProps` overriding `additionalProps`. To address this, we can fix the problem by conditionally adding `htmlFor` / `id` to `externalForwardedProps`. Additionally, I have included tests to verify that the behaviour with undefined values is now correct. 

Fixes #40112.

pr_data.title: [material-ui][AlertTitle] Enable extending Typography props
pr_data.body:
AlertTitle is now extending the properties of the Typography component according to the documentation. 
I used the Pick property from TypeScript because some properties existed in both components and had different types, so I made sure to add the ones that didn't exist in AlertTitle. 

e.g. color

> Interface 'AlertTitleProps' cannot simultaneously extend types 'TypographyProps' and 'InternalStandardProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>>'.
>   Named property 'color' of types 'TypographyProps' and 'InternalStandardProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>>' are not identical.ts(2320)

Fixes #42015

- [x] I have followed (at least) the [PR section of the contributing guide](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#sending-a-pull-request).

labels.description: This is the name of the generic UI component, not the React module!

pr_data.title: [docs] Update nextjs font optimization guide
pr_data.body:
closes #45537

Updated line 106 and 107 as per https://github.com/mui/material-ui/issues/45537#issuecomment-2727831866

Fixes the issue of --font-[variant] CSS custom property not computing the value correctly when next js font is applied to `<body>` instead of `<html/>`

pr_data.title: Improve Card Media description for clarity
pr_data.body:
This pull request clarifies the purpose of the _Card Media component_ by updating its description. The updated description accurately reflects the component's functionality and removes potential ambiguity. This change aims to enhance the overall user experience of the Material-UI documentation.

- Fixes #42859

Thank you for considering this pull request!
